intro: Blakea fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered Blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Blakea fasciculata is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
